excerpt: Serene green space featuring a modern Buddhist museum, meditation hall, bodhi trees & a large stupa.
detail_description: Buddha Smriti Park, also known as Buddha Memorial Park, is a serene urban oasis in Bihar. This 22-acre park was developed to celebrate the 2554th Birth Anniversary of Lord Buddha and features a modern Buddhist museum, meditation hall, bodhi trees, and a large stupa at its center.
name: Buddha Smriti Park
address: near Buddha park, Budh Vihar, Fraser Road Area, Patna, Bihar 800020, India

excerpt: This large, stupa-style granary, completed in 1786, offers sweeping city views from the top.
detail_description: Golghar, a stupa-style granary completed in 1786, is a prominent tourist attraction in Patna. Although climbing the 145 stairs to the top for city views may be restricted currently, it remains a popular spot for picnics and hosts sound and light shows from Tuesday to Sunday. Originally built as a storehouse, Golghar now stands as a recreational site drawing both local and international visitors annually.
name: Golghar
address: Opp.-Govt. Girls High school, Ashok Rajpath Rd, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

excerpt: Stately museum exhibiting archaeological finds, cultural objects & art from the Patna area.
detail_description: The Patna Museum is a must-visit for history enthusiasts, showcasing an impressive collection of artifacts from the Rajput and Mughal eras. With over seventy-five thousand antiquities, including stone sculptures, terracotta, and coins from the British era, the museum offers a comprehensive look at India's rich cultural heritage. Its unique architectural style reflects Indo-Saracenic influences. The museum's highlights include the Geological gallery, Dr.
name: Patna Museum
address: Buddh Marg, Lodipur, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

detail_description: Gandhi Ghat, situated on the banks of the River Ganga in Patna, is a picturesque tourist spot known for its scenic views and spiritual significance. It is a prominent ghat where Mahatma Gandhi's ashes were immersed, and it hosts the famous Evening Ganga Aarti that draws large crowds daily. The serene ambiance and the sight of 51 diyas lit during the aarti create a spiritually uplifting experience for visitors. Located just 4.
name: Gandhi Ghat
address: Patna, Bihar 800005, India

excerpt: Family-friendly place with educational displays & activities, plus a planetarium & 3D theater.
detail_description: Located in Patna, Bihar, Shrikrishna Science Centre is a family-friendly destination offering educational displays and activities for both school children and the local public. Established in 1978, it is dedicated to promoting science education through non-formal means of instruction. The center features models showcasing various branches of science and also includes a planetarium and 3D theater.
name: Shrikrishna Science Centre
address: West Gandhi Maidan, Raja Ji Salai, Dujra Diara, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant Bankipur area of Patna, Padri Ki Haveli is a remarkable church that beautifully showcases the rich tapestry of Bihar's history and culture. Known as the oldest church in the state, it was originally established by Roman Catholics in 1713 and later redesigned by Venetian architect Tirreto in 1772.
name: Padri Ki Haveli
address: near V2, Khaje Kalan, Sadikpur, Patna, Bihar 800008, India

excerpt: Sprawling, modern museum featuring exhibits on the region's history, art & culture.
detail_description: Bihar Museum in Patna is a modern and expansive museum that showcases the rich history, art, and culture of the region. Inaugurated in 2015 as part of an initiative to promote Bihar's cultural heritage, this museum was designed by renowned architect Fumihiko Maki. With 24,000 square meters of space, it offers a diverse collection of treasures from Bihar.
name: Bihar Museum
address: Jawaharlal Nehru Marg, Bailey Rd, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

detail_description: Agam Kuan, located in Patna, is a significant historical site dating back to the Emperor Maurya Ashoka Period. This ancient well is 105 feet deep and has a diameter of 20.2 feet. To prevent erosion, 44 feet of its depth is lined with bricks. The well also features a brick wall that extends outwards, forming a structure with eight arched windows. It stands as an impressive testament to ancient engineering and architectural prowess.
name: Agam Kuan
address: Patna, Bihar, India

excerpt: Large, tree-lined field for jogging, recreational cricket & city festivals, with a Gandhi statue.
detail_description: Gandhi Maidan, located in the heart of Patna, Bihar, India, is a sprawling green space with a rich historical significance. This large field has been a witness to numerous political and social events, including the Quit India movement in 1942. Over the years, it has hosted speeches by prominent figures like Mahatma Gandhi and Rajendra Prasad. The area is now used for various purposes such as recreational activities, city festivals, mass prayers, and trade fairs.
name: Gandhi Maidan
address: North -West Area of, Gandhi Maidan Rd, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

name: Mahavir Mandir
address: J587+X24, Khazanchi Rd, Lalbagh, Patna, Bihar 800004, India

excerpt: Kumhrar or Kumrahar is the area of Patna where remains of the ancient city of Pataliputra were excavated by the Archaeological Survey of India starting from 1913. It is located 5 km east of Patna Railway Station. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Kumhrar, also known as Kumrahar, is an archaeological site in Patna where the remains of the ancient city of Pataliputra have been excavated. This area holds great historical significance as it was once part of the Mauryan Empire. Visitors can explore the ruins and gain insight into the glorious history of Pataliputra, offering a fascinating glimpse into India's rich past.
name: Kumhrar
address: Patna, Bihar, India

excerpt: Established in 1919, this private museum features Asian & European art & antiques.
detail_description: Jalan Museum, also known as the Quila House, is a private museum located in Bihar's capital city. Established in 1919, it boasts an extensive collection of over 10,000 Asian and European artifacts and souvenirs.
name: Jalan Museum
address: Quila Rd, Hajiganj, Patna, Bihar 800008, India

excerpt: Hindu temple founded on one of 51 sites where parts of Devi Sati's corpse are said to have fallen.
detail_description: Shri Badi Patan Devi Temple in Patna is a significant Hindu temple, believed to be one of the 51 Indian Siddha Shakti Pithas. Legend has it that this sacred site is where parts of Devi Sati's corpse fell after Lord Vishnu used Sudarshan Chakra. The temple is dedicated to Goddess Durga and was previously known as Maa Sarvanand Kari Patneshwari.
name: Shri Badi Patan Devi Temple, Patna
address: Sadikpur, Patna, Bihar 800007, India

excerpt: Patna is an ancient city that sprawls along the south bank of the Ganges River in Bihar, northeast India. The state capital, it’s home to Bihar Museum, a contemporary landmark exhibiting bronze sculptures and old coins from the region. Nearby, Indo-Saracenic–style Patna Museum displays a casket believed to contain the Buddha’s ashes. Close to the river, the Golghar is a domed colonial granary overlooking the city.
detail_description: Patna, a historic city situated on the southern bank of the Ganges River in Bihar, northeastern India, is known for its cultural and historical landmarks. The Bihar Museum showcases ancient artifacts such as bronze sculptures and coins, while the Patna Museum houses a casket believed to hold Buddha's ashes. Overlooking the city is Golghar, a colonial granary with a domed structure.
name: Patna
address: Bihar, India

detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant city of Patna, the Indira Gandhi Planetarium, affectionately known as Taramandal or Patna Planetarium, stands as one of Asia's largest and oldest planetariums. This remarkable venue is a treasure trove for astronomy enthusiasts and curious minds alike. Visitors can immerse themselves in captivating exhibits that delve into the mysteries of galaxies and celestial phenomena.
name: Indira Gandhi Planetarium
address: J46J+4Q4, Jawaharlal Nehru Marg, Adalatganj, Kidwaipuri, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

detail_description: Gol Ghar is a must-see historical site with a nearby park, making it an ideal destination for history enthusiasts and nature lovers alike.
name: Gol Ghar
address: Raja Ji Salai, Lodipur, Patna, Mohammadpur urf Chainpur, Bihar 800001, India

excerpt: Founded in 1967, this museum explores the life of Mahatma Gandhi via photos, movies & manuscripts.
detail_description: Gandhi Sangrahalaya, also known as Gandhi Museum, is a dedicated museum located near Patna City Centre that offers a deep exploration of the life and teachings of Mahatma Gandhi. Established in 1967, it houses personal belongings, photographs, documents, and audio-visual materials related to his life and legacy. The museum presents a visual biography through photos depicting key moments in Gandhi's journey, along with quotes, models, and memorabilia.
name: Gandhi Sangrahalaya
address: J4CR+9X5, Ashok Raj Path, North, West Gandhi Maidan, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

detail_description: Patan Devi Temple, also known as Maa Patneshwari Mandir, is one of the oldest and most renowned temples in Patna. It is considered to be one of the 51 Siddha Shakti Pithas in India, with a history and legend that dates back to the belief that it was where the right thigh of Devi Sati fell. Visitors often describe it as a lovely and peaceful place surrounded by beautiful nature.
name: Patan Devi Temple Gujrati Samaj
address: Buddh Marg, Fraser Road Area, Patna, Bihar 800001, India

name: Rajendra Smriti Sangrahalaya
address: J4J6+WGQ, Bankipur - Danapur Rd, Sadaquat Ashram, Kurji, Patna, Bihar 800010, India

detail_description: The Mahatma Gandhi Setu, also referred to as the Gandhi Setu, is a newly reconstructed iron bridge that stands as one of Asia's longest river bridges. Spanning across the River Ganges, it connects Patna and Hajipur in Bihar, offering a beautiful and breathtaking view of the surroundings. This iconic bridge serves as a crucial link for transportation and is admired by both locals and tourists for its impressive structure and scenic location.
name: Mahatma Gandhi Setu
address: J652+H24, Mahatma Gandhi Setu, Sadikpur, Patna, Bihar 800007, India
